verses.kjv: Then Job answered the LORD, and said,
verses.ct: Then Job responded to the LORD and said,

verses.kjv: I know that thou canst do every thing, and that no thought can be withholden from thee.
verses.ct: "I know that you can do all things, and that no purpose of yours can be stopped.

verses.kjv: Who is he that hideth counsel without knowledge? therefore have I uttered that I understood not; things too wonderful for me, which I knew not.
verses.ct: You asked, 'Who is this that obscures my plans without understanding?' That is why I spoke about things I didn't comprehend — matters too amazing for me that I had no knowledge of.

verses.kjv: Hear, I beseech thee, and I will speak: I will demand of thee, and declare thou unto me.
verses.ct: You said, 'Listen, and I will speak; I will question you, and you will answer me.'

verses.kjv: I have heard of thee by the hearing of the ear: but now mine eye seeth thee.
verses.ct: Before, I had only heard about you through what others told me, but now I have seen you with my own eyes.

verses.kjv: Wherefore I abhor myself, and repent in dust and ashes.
verses.ct: That is why I take back what I said and sit in dust and ashes, deeply sorry."

verses.kjv: And it was so, that after the LORD had spoken these words unto Job, the LORD said to Eliphaz the Temanite, My wrath is kindled against thee, and against thy two friends: for ye have not spoken of me the thing that is right, as my servant Job hath.
verses.ct: After the LORD had spoken these words to Job, the LORD said to Eliphaz the Temanite, "I am angry with you and your 2 friends, because you have not spoken truthfully about me the way my servant Job has.

verses.kjv: Therefore take unto you now seven bullocks and seven rams, and go to my servant Job, and offer up for yourselves a burnt offering; and my servant Job shall pray for you: for him will I accept: lest I deal with you after your folly, in that ye have not spoken of me the thing which is right, like my servant Job.
verses.ct: So now, take 7 bulls and 7 rams and go to my servant Job. Offer a burnt offering for yourselves, and my servant Job will pray for you. I will accept his prayer and not punish you for your foolishness, since you have not spoken truthfully about me the way my servant Job has."

verses.kjv: So Eliphaz the Temanite and Bildad the Shuhite and Zophar the Naamathite went, and did according as the LORD commanded them: the LORD also accepted Job.
verses.ct: So Eliphaz the Temanite, Bildad the Shuhite, and Zophar the Naamathite went and did exactly what the LORD had told them, and the LORD accepted Job's prayer.

verses.kjv: And the LORD turned the captivity of Job, when he prayed for his friends: also the LORD gave Job twice as much as he had before.
verses.ct: The LORD restored Job's prosperity when he prayed for his friends, and the LORD gave Job twice as much as he previously had.

verses.kjv: Then came there unto him all his brethren, and all his sisters, and all they that had been of his acquaintance before, and did eat bread with him in his house: and they bemoaned him, and comforted him over all the evil that the LORD had brought upon him: every man also gave him a piece of money, and every one an earring of gold.
verses.ct: Then all his brothers, all his sisters, and everyone who had known him before came and shared a meal with him at his home. They expressed sympathy and comforted him regarding all the suffering that the LORD had allowed to come upon him. Each person gave him a piece of silver and a gold ring.

verses.kjv: So the LORD blessed the latter end of Job more than his beginning: for he had fourteen thousand sheep, and six thousand camels, and a thousand yoke of oxen, and a thousand she asses.
verses.ct: The LORD blessed the second half of Job's life even more than the first. He came to own 14,000 sheep, 6,000 camels, 1,000 pairs of oxen, and 1,000 female donkeys.

verses.kjv: He had also seven sons and three daughters.
verses.ct: He also had 7 sons and 3 daughters.

verses.kjv: And he called the name of the first, Jemima; and the name of the second, Kezia; and the name of the third, Kerenhappuch.
verses.ct: He named the first daughter Jemima, the second Kezia, and the third Kerenhappuch.

verses.kjv: And in all the land were no women found so fair as the daughters of Job: and their father gave them inheritance among their brethren.
verses.ct: Nowhere in the entire land could women be found as beautiful as Job's daughters, and their father gave them an inheritance alongside their brothers.

verses.kjv: After this lived Job an hundred and forty years, and saw his sons, and his sons’ sons, even four generations.
verses.ct: After this, Job lived 140 years and got to see his children, grandchildren, and great-grandchildren — 4 generations.

verses.kjv: So Job died, being old and full of days.
verses.ct: Then Job died at a very old age, having lived a long and full life.
